title: Chinese Chicken Wings Recipe
description: These Chinese chicken wings are marinated overnight in a mixture of soy sauce, brown sugar, and garlic powder, then oven-baked until hot and crisp.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Appetizers and Snacks Meat and Poultry Chicken Chinese Chicken Wings 4.5 (90) 74 Reviews 16 Photos These Chinese chicken wings were my late mother's recipe for potlucks. Now I am asked to bring this dish to parties. Submitted by Jeanette Boisvert Updated on September 12, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 16 16 16 16 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 5 mins Additional Time: 8 hrs Total Time: 9 hrs 10 mins Servings: 12 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 2 cups soy sauce 2 cups brown sugar 2 tablespoons garlic powder 5 pounds chicken wings, split and tips discarded Directions Stir together soy sauce, brown sugar, and garlic powder in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Place chicken wings in a large bowl. Pour soy sauce mixture over wings and toss to coat evenly. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap. Allow chicken to marinate in the refrigerator for 8 hours to overnight. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Pour chicken wings and marinade into a 9x13-inch baking dish. Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil. Bake in the preheated oven until thoroughly hot, about 45 minutes. Remove foil and bake for 15 more minutes. Serve hot. I Made It Print 162 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Chinese Chicken Wings 01 of 16 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 16 Photo by  ChillyAle3960 10/27/2024 Great flavors Worth the effort Family favorite A keeper! Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser Air fryer for 25 minutes. Marinated for 36 hours and added ginger,garlic and onion powder. Cut the brown sugar in half. They were excellent. Definitely tastes Chinese. Will make again 03 of 16 Photo by  Missie Summers 05/31/2020 04 of 16 Photo by  TiTi Bug 01/25/2020 05 of 16 Photo by  tressa 05/03/2019 Delicious!!!! I added 3 Tsp’s of Chili Garlic Sauce for a little kick 06 of 16 Photo by  Robert Curenton 09/15/2017 07 of 16 Photo by  Robert Curenton 09/15/2017 08 of 16 Photo by  twin1 08/04/2015 I added crush red peppers and pineapple . I loved it. 09 of 16 Photo by  hotguy 08/03/2015 10 of 16 Photo by  chef bon bon 07/07/2015 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Sesame Oil Chicken Wings 40 Ratings Vietnamese Golden Chicken Wings 41 Ratings Curry-Spiced Chicken Wings 23 Ratings Teriyaki Chicken Wings 220 Ratings Five-Spice Chicken Wings 43 Ratings Easy Baked Chicken Wings 60 Ratings Oven-Fried Chicken Wings 108 Ratings Bat Wings 40 Ratings Hawaiian Chicken Wings 22 Ratings Japanese Chicken Wings 1,484 Ratings Ginger Orange Glazed Chicken Wings 51 Ratings Halloween Black Bat Wings 14 Ratings Half Time Hoisin Chicken Wings 60 Ratings Thai Chicken Wings 65 Ratings Lemon Pepper Chicken Wings 64 Ratings Bat Wings (Halloween Sweet Wing Appetizer) Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Jeanette Boisvert
instructions: Stir together soy sauce, brown sugar, and garlic powder in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat and allow to cool.;Place chicken wings in a large bowl. Pour soy sauce mixture over wings and toss to coat evenly. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap. Allow chicken to marinate in the refrigerator for 8 hours to overnight.;Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Pour chicken wings and marinade into a 9x13-inch baking dish. Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil.;Bake in the preheated oven until thoroughly hot, about 45 minutes. Remove foil and bake for 15 more minutes. Serve hot.
